vogar.tasks

Class RunActionTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • vogar.tasks.Task
      • vogar.tasks.RunActionTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HostMonitor.Handler
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RunActivityTask

    public class RunActionTask
extends Task
implements HostMonitor.Handler
    Executes a single action and then prints the result.

      • runnerThreadId

        private final java.lang.ThreadLocal<java.lang.Integer> runnerThreadId

      • isAction

        public boolean isAction()
        Description copied from class: Task
        Returns true if this task is an action task. The queue imposes limits on how many actions may be run concurrently.
        Overrides:
        isAction in class Task

        public Command createActionCommand(Action action,
                          java.lang.String skipPast,
                          int monitorPort)
        Create the command that executes the action.
        Parameters:
        skipPast - the last outcome to skip, or null to run all outcomes.
        monitorPort - the port to accept connections on, or -1 for the

      • useSocketMonitor

        protected boolean useSocketMonitor()
        Returns true if this mode requires a socket connection for reading test results. Otherwise all communication happens over the output stream of the forked process.

      • monitorPort

        private int monitorPort(int defaultValue)

      • start

        public void start(java.lang.String outcomeName,
         java.lang.String runnerClass)
        Specified by:
        start in interface HostMonitor.Handler
        runnerClass - can be null, indicating nothing is actually being run. This will happen in the event of an impending error.

      • toQualifiedOutcomeName

        private java.lang.String toQualifiedOutcomeName(java.lang.String outcomeName)
        Test suites that use main classes in the default package have lame outcome names like "Clear" rather than "com.foo.Bar.Clear". In that case, just replace the outcome name with the action name.
